bullet_summary: Authorities have confirmed three Brits are among 16 people who were killed in Wednesday's accident

items.title: Three Britons among 16 people killed in Lisbon funicular crash, police confirm
items.standfirst: Portuguese investigators find no evidence of sabotage, with mechanical or maintenance issues among possible causes‘Someone needs to answer for what happened’: Lisbon reacts to streetcar crash that killed 16Portuguese police have confirmed that three Britons were among the 16 people killed in Lisbon on Wednesday evening when one of the city’s funicular streetcars derailed and hurtled down a hill and into a building.The accident, described by Portugal’s prime minister, Luís Montenegro, as “one of the biggest tragedies in our recent history”, left 21 people injured, five of whom are in a serious condition. items.title: Lisbon funicular crash: French woman among dead as probe goes on
items.standfirst: Portuguese authorities were investigating on Thursday what caused a Lisbon funicular railway popular with tourists to hurtle down a hill, killing at least 16 people and injuring 22 more when it crashed into a building on Wednesday. Meanwhile, details about those killed are starting to emerge, with French-Canadian woman and a US citizen among those confirmed to have lost their lives.
items.content: Portuguese authorities were investigating on Thursday what caused a Lisbon funicular railway popular with tourists to hurtle down a hill, killing at least 16 people and injuring 22 more when it crashed into a building on Wednesday. Meanwhile, details about those killed are starting to emerge, with French-Canadian woman and a US citizen among those confirmed to have lost their lives.

items.title: French national among 16 people killed in Lisbon funicular train crash
items.standfirst: A French woman died in the Lisbon funicular train derailment that killed 16 people earlier this week, France's foreign minister confirmed on Friday, as Portuguese authorities investigated what caused the cable car popular with tourists to hurtle down a hill and crash into a building.
items.content: A French woman died in the Lisbon funicular train derailment that killed 16 people earlier this week, France's foreign minister confirmed on Friday, as Portuguese authorities investigated what caused the cable car popular with tourists to hurtle down a hill and crash into a building.

items.content: A national day of mourning began in Portugal Thursday, after at least 17 people were killed and 22 injured when a popular funicular railway derailed in Lisbon.

items.content: At least 15 people were killed and 18 were injured in a crash of a popular funicular railway in Lisbon, Portugal, on Wednesday, according to local authorities.

ai_summary: Sixteen people died in a funicular derailment in Lisbon, Portugal.
Three British nationals were confirmed among the fatalities by authorities.
At least one American was also among the deceased in the accident.
Over twenty people were injured, with five in serious condition.
Portuguese investigators found no evidence of sabotage in the crash.

items.title: Western troops in Ukraine would be ‘legitimate’ target for Russia, Putin warns
items.standfirst: Any Western troops deployed to Ukraine would be a "legitimate" target for Moscow's army, Russian President Vladimir Putin warned on Friday, a day after 26 countries pledged to deploy protective troops on Ukrainian soil if a ceasefire is reached.
items.content: Any Western troops deployed to Ukraine would be a "legitimate" target for Moscow's army, Russian President Vladimir Putin warned on Friday, a day after 26 countries pledged to deploy protective troops on Ukrainian soil if a ceasefire is reached.

items.title: 26 countries agree to deploy troops in Ukraine if ceasefire reached
items.standfirst: 26 European countries formally agreed on Thursday to provide security guarantees for Ukraine, committing to sending troops to Ukraine in the event of a ceasefire with Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky commended the agreement and said those already in favor of the plan "count on" the US to act as a "backstop" within the framework of security guarantees for his country.
items.content: 26 European countries formally agreed on Thursday to provide security guarantees for Ukraine, committing to sending troops to Ukraine in the event of a ceasefire with Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky commended the agreement and said those already in favor of the plan "count on" the US to act as a "backstop" within the framework of security guarantees for his country.

items.title: Trump says Putin and Zelenskyy are 'not ready' for peace as European powers meet

ai_summary: Russian President Putin stated foreign troops in Ukraine would be targets.

Trump said Putin and Zelenskyy are not ready for peace talks.

clusters.title: Tycoon who led campaign to decriminalise cannabis to be Thai PM
clusters.neutral_headline: Anutin Charnvirakul Elected Thai Prime Minister
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, Reuters Top News, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Tycoon who led campaign to decriminalise cannabis to be Thai PM
items.standfirst: Anutin Charnvirakul voted in by parliament after promising election in four months, as Thaksin Shinawatra jets outAnutin Charnvirakul, a staunch royalist, has been selected as Thailand’s next prime minister, after securing the backing of the majority of lawmakers in parliament.The 58-year-old tycoon turned politician is considered a conservative, though he made a name for himself for leading a campaign to decriminalise cannabis. He was voted in after a chaotic scramble by parties to gain enough support to replace the ousted PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who was removed from office by a court ruling. Continue reading...
items.content: Anutin Charnvirakul voted in by parliament after promising election in four months, as Thaksin Shinawatra jets outAnutin Charnvirakul, a staunch royalist, has been selected as Thailand’s next prime minister, after securing the backing of the majority of lawmakers in parliament.The 58-year-old tycoon turned politician is considered a conservative, though he made a name for himself for leading a campaign to decriminalise cannabis. He was voted in after a chaotic scramble by parties to gain enough support to replace the ousted PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who was removed from office by a court ruling. Continue reading...

items.title: Anutin Charnvirakul named Thai PM
items.standfirst: Anutin Charnvirakul, leader of the Bhumjaithai Party and a party-list Member of Parliament (MP), was voted in as Thailand's 32nd prime minister on Friday after securing a majority in the House of Repr...
items.content: Anutin Charnvirakul, leader of the Bhumjaithai Party and a party-list Member of Parliament (MP), was voted in as Thailand's 32nd prime minister on Friday after securing a majority in the House of Repr...

items.title: Anutin Elected New Thai Prime Minister as Political Crisis Eases
Thai parliament elects Anutin Charnvirakul as prime minister
items.standfirst: The vote is a major blow to the Shinawatra clan, a mainstay of Thai politics for the past two decades.
items.content: The vote is a major blow to the Shinawatra clan, a mainstay of Thai politics for the past two decades.

items.title: Thailand’s Anutin elected PM in parliamentary vote, Thaksin leaves country
items.standfirst: Thailand's Anutin Charnvirakul was elected prime minister on Friday after breezing through a parliamentary vote which came hours after former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra suddenly left the country on his private jet for Dubai. A Thai court last week sacked Thaksin's daughter and protégé from the prime minister's post.
items.content: Thailand's Anutin Charnvirakul was elected prime minister on Friday after breezing through a parliamentary vote which came hours after former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra suddenly left the country on his private jet for Dubai. A Thai court last week sacked Thaksin's daughter and protégé from the prime minister's post.

ai_summary: Anutin Charnvirakul was voted in as Thailand's new prime minister.
He is the leader of the Bhumjaithai Party.
The vote followed the removal of Paetongtarn Shinawatra.
Thaksin Shinawatra left the country shortly before the vote.
Anutin secured a majority in the House of Representatives.

items.title: Trump to rename Defence Department as 'Department of War'
items.standfirst: Seeking to accomplish a long-gestating goal, US President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order on Friday that the Department of Defence be renamed as the Department of War, using the US military branch's original name as a "secondary" title until Congress authorises a formal alteration.
items.content: Seeking to accomplish a long-gestating goal, US President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order on Friday that the Department of Defence be renamed as the Department of War, using the US military branch's original name as a "secondary" title until Congress authorises a formal alteration.

items.title: Trump to rebrand defence department as the Department of War

items.content: US president to sign executive order on Friday that will allow Pentagon to use new title in official communications

ai_summary: Donald Trump plans to rename the Department of Defense.
The new name will be the Department of War.
The original name will be a secondary title.
Trump wants to focus on "warfighting" and a "warrior ethos".
The change will be implemented via an executive order.

clusters.title: Prosecutors launch probe into Argentina couple over Nazi-looted painting

bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, NBC World, BBC World

items.title: Prosecutors launch probe into Argentina couple over Nazi-looted painting
items.standfirst: The painting, Portrait of a Lady, had disappeared from the collection of a Jewish art dealer during World War II.
items.content: The painting, Portrait of a Lady, had disappeared from the collection of a Jewish art dealer during World War II.

items.title: Long-lost painting looted by Nazis recovered in Argentina
items.standfirst: A long-lost painting by Italian master Giuseppe Ghislandi, which was looted by the Nazis, has been recovered in Argentina after it was spotted in an online property listing. "Portrait of a Lady" is an 18th century painting which belonged to a Jewish art collector before it was stolen during World War II. The artwork is now with the federal prosecutor's office.
items.content: A long-lost painting by Italian master Giuseppe Ghislandi, which was looted by the Nazis, has been recovered in Argentina after it was spotted in an online property listing. "Portrait of a Lady" is an 18th century painting which belonged to a Jewish art collector before it was stolen during World War II. The artwork is now with the federal prosecutor's office.

items.title: Long-lost painting looted by Nazis recovered after it was spotted in a real estate listing
items.standfirst: It took 80 years to track down and a week of international intrigue, but a long-lost 18th-century painting looted by the Nazis has been recovered after it was spotted in a recent Argentinian real estate listing.
items.content: It took 80 years to track down and a week of international intrigue, but a long-lost 18th-century painting looted by the Nazis has been recovered after it was spotted in a recent Argentinian real estate listing.

The artwork belonged to a Jewish art collector.

clusters.title: Germany stunned by Slovakia in their first World Cup qualifier
clusters.neutral_headline: Germany Suffers Shocking Loss in World Cup Qualifying Match
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Al Jazeera

items.title: Germany stunned by Slovakia in their first World Cup qualifier
items.standfirst: Germany already have their backs against the wall after a 2-0 defeat to Slovakia in their first match of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers. This is the first time that Germany have lost an away qualifying match. Meanwhile, Spain had no trouble securing a 3-0 win in Bulgaria, while Belgium crushed Liechtenstein 6-0.
items.content: Germany already have their backs against the wall after a 2-0 defeat to Slovakia in their first match of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers. clusters.title: Venezuelan military planes buzzed US ship in ‘highly provocative move’, Pentagon says
clusters.neutral_headline: Venezuela Aircraft Fly Near US Warship, Pentagon Says
bullet_summary: President Donald Trump said the Venezuelan vessel belonged to a drug cartel
Reported by France24, Al Jazeera

items.title: Venezuelan military planes buzzed US ship in ‘highly provocative move’, Pentagon says
items.standfirst: Two Venezuelan military aircraft flew near a US Navy vessel in international waters, the Pentagon disclosed Thursday, in what it called a "highly provocative" escalation. The incident came days after US strikes on a Venezuelan boat in the the Caribbean killed 11 people. President Donald Trump said the Venezuelan vessel belonged to a drug cartel.
items.content: Two Venezuelan military aircraft flew near a US Navy vessel in international waters, the Pentagon disclosed Thursday, in what it called a "highly provocative" escalation. The incident came days after US strikes on a Venezuelan boat in the the Caribbean killed 11 people. President Donald Trump said the Venezuelan vessel belonged to a drug cartel.
